news.title: Best Poster Award at ICAIF 2024
news.summary: Our PhD student Sohyeon Kwon received the Best Poster Award at the 5th ACM International Conference on AI in Finance for her work 'Can GANs Learn the Stylized Facts of Financial Time Series?'

paragraphs: We are thrilled to announce that our PhD student Sohyeon Kwon has been awarded the prestigious Best Poster Award at the 5th ACM International Conference on AI in Finance (ICAIF 2024), held in Brooklyn, New York.

Her research, titled 'Can GANs Learn the Stylized Facts of Financial Time Series?', explores the capability of Generative Adversarial Networks to capture and reproduce the complex statistical properties observed in financial market data.

This recognition highlights our lab's commitment to advancing the intersection of artificial intelligence and quantitative finance. The work demonstrates novel approaches to generating synthetic financial data that preserves important market characteristics, which has significant implications for risk management and strategy testing.
highlights: Novel application of GANs in financial time series
Implications for synthetic data generation in finance

quotes.text: This award reflects the hard work and innovation of our entire research team. We're pushing the boundaries of what's possible with AI in finance.
quotes.author: Prof. Yongjae Lee

images.caption: Sohyeon Kwon receiving the Best Poster Award

news.title: Paper Accepted at AAAI 2025
news.summary: Our paper 'Geodesic Flow Kernels for Semi-Supervised Learning on Mixed-Variable Tabular Dataset' has been accepted at AAAI-25 with 23.4% acceptance rate.

paragraphs: We are pleased to announce that our paper has been accepted for presentation at the 39th Annual AAAI Conference on Artificial Intelligence (AAAI-25), one of the premier venues in AI research.

The paper introduces a novel approach using geodesic flow kernels for handling mixed-variable tabular datasets in semi-supervised learning settings, addressing a critical challenge in real-world machine learning applications.

news.title: Four MS Students Successfully Graduate
news.summary: Congratulations to Yejin Kim, Seonmi Kim, Seyoung Kim, and Youngbin Lee on successfully defending their MS theses and joining industry positions.

paragraphs: We celebrate the graduation of four talented MS students who have successfully defended their theses and are moving on to exciting career opportunities in the industry.

Their research contributions span various areas including personalized stock recommendations, NFT recommendation systems, GANs-based anomaly detection, and temporal graph networks for financial applications.

list_sections.title: Graduates and Their Next Steps
items: Yejin Kim - Data Scientist at Meritz Fire & Marine Insurance
Seonmi Kim - Data Scientist at NICE P&I
Youngbin Lee - AI Researcher at elice
